titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Utility Companies Operating in the North American West
Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Utility Companies Operating in the North American West
titlestmt.author: by Ellen Ellickson and Caroline Wilcox Reul

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 05:08

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous financial materials concerning utility companies operating in the North American West

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning utility companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, company descriptions, newspaper clippings, press releases, prospectuses, reports, maps, stock and bond offerings, plans for exchange of securities, notices and letters to the stockholders, dividend notices, deposit agreements, certificates of deposit, trust and mortgage indentures, trust agreements, agreements of assignment and pledge, bankruptcy notices to creditors, plans of reorganization and court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Most of these financial materials were part of a collection acquired by Yale in 1922 from William H. Brown of West Haven, Conn. The collection, initially called the William H. Brown Statistical Library, numbered some 23,000 documents and covered the years 1890 to 1917. The collection was merged with similar materials already in the University Library and later expanded by gifts from Brown and others to become what is now known as the William H. Brown Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning utility companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, company descriptions, newspaper clippings, press releases, prospectuses, reports, maps, stock and bond offerings, plans for exchange of securities, notices and letters to the stockholders, dividend notices, deposit agreements, certificates of deposit, trust and mortgage indentures, trust agreements, agreements of assignment and pledge, bankruptcy notices to creditors, plans of reorganization and court documents. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by company name.

did.unittitle: Central States Power and Light Corporation
Cities Service Power and Light Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Central Louisiana Electric Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the he Missouri Utilities Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Consumers Power Company of Minnesota.

Puget Sound Traction, Light & Power Company

scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Roswell Public Service Company.

scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Intermountain Railway, Light & Power Company.
